New Services-filtering Feature in the Justia Lawyer Directory!

We are excited to announce a new services-filtering feature in the Justia Lawyer Directory, allowing users to easily find lawyers who provide particular services in a practice area. For example, users looking for business lawyers can filter to find those that provide “mergers and acquisitions” services, filter family lawyers to find those who offer “adoption” services, and filter injury lawyers to find those who handle "truck accidents".

As a courtesy, we have pre-populated your profile with all the service areas for the practice areas that you have listed. Read more about the services filter here, and be sure to keep your profile up to date so potential clients can find you!

Tech News

Amazon is Now Selling Prescription Drugs, and Prime Members Can Get Massive Discounts if They Pay Without Insurance

The Amazon Pharmacy service offers drugs through Amazon’s main website, and Prime members can get two-day delivery and discounts on both generic and brand-name drugs

Google Says Chrome 87 Has the Biggest Performance Boost in Years

Chrome will reduce CPU usage by prioritizing active tabs, while also improving system battery life, requiring less power and memory, and launching the browser and loading pages faster.

SEO News

Top 10 Changes That Impacted Google My Business in 2020

Highlights include adding suggested categories for GMB Products, launching features related to COVID-19, adding a “more hours” option, and adding the ability to flag user profiles.

Google Goes Deep On Dupe Detection & Canonicalization

To detect duplicate content, Google reduces the content into a hash or checksum and then compares the checksums, which allows it to catch near-duplicates as well as exact duplicates.

Some Google Algorithm Updates Are Jarring & Others More Gradual

Certain updates have resulted in huge changes in rankings within a few days, but more recent updates result in a gradual impact over weeks, which is the pace that Google often prefers.

What is Google AMP and Do I Need It for SEO?

Benefits of AMP include faster loading speeds, increased website engagement, improved ranking and traffic, lower bounce rates, increased ad views, and higher click-through rates.

Google Passage Ranking - Martin Splitt Answers Questions

The new ranking system will help users with long form content by ranking a small section of an article, but it will not require adjustments by publishers except possibly clarifying headings.

Is Your Website at Risk for an ADA Accessibility Lawsuit?

All industries must comply with website accessibility laws, but certain industries face greater risks, such as real estate, health care, autos, education, finance, food, and e-commerce.

Did You Know?

Justia’s Amplify umbrellas a number of different advertising channels known to increase conversions. The Justia Amplify service also includes a customized client review platform that showcases your photo, practice areas, link to your website, and more.

From Google’s Local Services Ads (LSAs), Google Ads, PPC, Bing Ads PPC, and Facebook Remarketing, our marketing professionals will devise strategies that align with the overall goals and characteristics of your law firm.

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews

Featured Lawyer

David Alan Wolf

JACKSONVILLE, FL

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews is a system designed for lawyers to provide valuable insight from peers and colleagues personally familiar with the lawyer’s work.

Lawyers who have received reviews will have a badge on their profile showing their Justia Lawyer Rating, a numerical representation of the reviews they have received. Our research shows that the Rating Badge is the most used search filter in the Justia Lawyer Directory.

Don’t miss out on your chance to showcase your Justia Lawyer Rating badge on your websites, blogs, and other properties!
Read More

Social Media News

Adobe Spark and Square Join Forces for a “Holiday Small Business Boost”

Adobe Spark and Square have launched a contest to win a $10,000 media buy credit and a subscription to Adobe Spark Premium, which requires signing up for a free trial of Spark.

9 Social Media Video Ideas to Modernize Your Corporate Communications

Suggestions include FAQ videos, “top five” videos, “this or that?” videos featuring employees, behind the scenes videos of company life, product promos, and videos on trending news.

Facebook Messenger and Instagram Add Disappearing Messages Feature

“Vanish” mode on Messenger and Instagram allows users to send spontaneous messages that disappear automatically when they are seen or when the recipient leaves the chat.

TikTok Wins Yet Another Legal Reprieve, Keeping it Running in the US

The Chinese-owned social network received an extension of time to finalize its sale of US operations to Oracle and Wal-mart, while consequences for failing to comply remain unclear.

Twitter Rolls Out Stories, AKA ‘Fleets,’ to All Users; Will Also Test a Clubhouse Rival

The “Fleets” product allows users to post ephemeral content that will disappear in 24 hours, while Twitter also plans to test an audio-based feature that will support live conversations.

Facebook Makes Its Latest Experimental App Available to All Users

The E.gg app allows users to create web-based collages of their favorite things and share these canvases with others, including people who do not have the app, via a unique URL.

Legal Industry News

Zoom Lied to Users About End-to-End Encryption for Years, FTC Says

Zoom offered a lower level of security than advertised and has agreed with the FTC to create a comprehensive security program and refrain from privacy and security misrepresentations.

California Just Passed Tougher Privacy Rules That May Reverberate Nationwide

Voters approved Proposition 24, which will impose stiffer fines on companies that break certain data privacy rules and create a new state agency to help enforce privacy laws.

Appeals Court Rejects Affirmative Action Lawsuit Against Harvard

Since Harvard did not engage in racial balancing or use quotas, the judges found that its limited consideration of race in admissions was a legitimate effort to achieve student diversity.

Supreme Court Appears Likely To Uphold Obamacare

Both liberal and conservative judges showed skepticism toward the argument that the Affordable Care Act should be struck down in its entirety if the individual mandate is removed.

Tip of the Month

[Id ipsum dolor ipsum quis minim irure exercitation anim voluptate ullamco est aliquip.]

[Consequat commodo et irure deserunt sunt fugiat. Nostrud amet adipisicing nisi laborum commodo. Excepteur magna excepteur qui laborum cillum nulla consectetur esse deserunt voluptate anim. Ex ad voluptate ea irure duis eiusmod elit elit eu duis Lorem non.]

[Aute labore esse commodo irure dolore mollit aute minim dolore ullamco. Aute sint laboris mollit mollit mollit ut nisi laboris culpa ex eu tempor consectetur incididunt. Sint ex mollit ad laboris ut sunt ut non consectetur cupidatat quis aliquip eiusmod. Consequat irure cupidatat officia Lorem.]

JurisPro Expert Witness Directory

JurisPro provides a free directory of expert witnesses in over 10,000 areas of expertise.

Medical Billing Expert Witness Testimony Allowed in Accident Case

Medical Billing Expert Witness allowed to testify despite allegations that testimony was based on an unverified third party database.

Police Procedures Expert Witness Testimony Allowed in Pepper Spray Case

The U.S. District Court of Hawaii allowed a Police Procedures Expert Witness to testify regarding the use of pepper spray in a wrongful death suit.

Economics Expert Witness Testimony Allowed in Employment Dispute

Economics Expert Witness was allowed to testify in a wrongful termination suit despite lack of experience evaluating software-as-a-service company.

Weather & Meteorology Expert Witness Allowed to Testify in Fire Litigation

A Weather & Meteorology Expert Witness was allowed to testify regarding lightning strikes that caused a fire.

Learn how to research experts here: JurisPro Expert Witness White Paper
